org.magnos.util
Class Signal

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.util.Signal

public class Signal
extends java.lang.Object

Provides a way for several threads to send signals between each other. The send method will return the number of unrecieved signals have been sent and it will increment the number of signals. The recieve method will return the number of signals sent while reseting the signal counter back to zero. If a signals are being sent during a receive they will not be overriden, receive will only return the number of signals sent at the beginning of the method invocation. In other words no signals will be lost by receiving because it doesn't technically reset it back to zero. The recieved method returns if more than 0 signals have been sent. Any thread can send and receive signals.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Constructor Summary
Signal()
           
 
Method Summary
 int receive()
          Recieves all signals sent and returns how many were sent.
 boolean recieved()
          Receives all signals sent and returns true if any signals were received.
 int send()
          Sends a single signal and returns how many signals have not been received before the signal was sent.

Constructor Detail

Signal

public Signal()
Method Detail

send

public int send()
Sends a single signal and returns how many signals have not been received before the signal was sent.

Returns:
The number of signals sent and not received before this invokation.

receive

public int receive()
Recieves all signals sent and returns how many were sent. If signals are being sent while this method is executing they will remain in the signal counter and not be ignored.

Returns:
The number of signals received

recieved

public boolean recieved()
Receives all signals sent and returns true if any signals were received.

Returns:
True if signals were sent, false otherwise.
